reviews.review_msg: best
I'm not an economics major, but I loved his International Finance class.
Prof Kasa is amazing and willing to help. Go to his office hours, if there is anything confusing you. The course is easy too.

Kasa talked extremely fast. So if English is not your first language, be prepared to take quick notes. He is knowledgeable and experienced in the economics sector, perhaps that is the reason why he sometimes skims through the parts where he thought students would know. He values a hard-working student so don't be afraid to attend his office hours.

Fantastic professor! Even though he talks fast, he always paused and asked students if they had any questions. He also told interesting stories about past economic events and his time during the FED. Exams and problem sets were not difficult at all, just study the past material.

Highly recommend if you're interested in pursuing finance.

He gives great lecture, interesting assignments, thought provoking comments and directions. I wish my brain was at the speed of his speech. Its a huge pity for not having the chops to appreciate his intelligence and awesome insight sharing. Sadly when you learn from the best, you need to have all these preparation to appreciate things. do ur best.

Ken writes incredible notes. He provides all of his past exams, so as long as you spend the time doing them in preparation for the midterm and final, you'll do really well. He is a really nice prof, but his lectures are SO boring. I would recommend going to them anyways even if you don't pay attention because he took attendance once
Boring professor. Talks way too fast. Does not care about students. Cannot even get a hold of him outside of lecture hours. He is never at his office hours. Avoid this prof if you can.

Kasa is definitely knowledgable and he assign relevant Econ articles to read which I thought was pretty neat. He helps you gain real world knowledge. However, his lectures are super dry and he talks too fast. It seemed to me that he was not interested in teaching the course to undergrad students. His approach is well-suited for grad level.
Talk too fast in lecture. Basically don't care if the students can catch up or clearly understand anything.

Tests are straightforward.  If you read the textbook and keep up, and practice the various test examples in his site you should be fine!  The final was much easier then the Midterm.  Essentially all you have to do is understand the concepts and everything should fall in place.

Decent class (albeit slightly dry). Will do well if work really hard and review old Problem set and exams to prepare for final. Exams are similar to past exams. Goes through notes in class word for word basically. Recommend the textbook.

Worst Proff I have ever had. Speaks a mile a minute and when you ask him a question he goes off in tangents about multiple other things. When you don't understand concepts in class he basically tells you to "stare hard enough and you'll figure it out." Worst proff I've had and worst econ class I have ever taken at SFU. Enough said.

he's a good prof. very fair on the mark distribution. i got a C- in the midterm (b/c of the TA's way of marking) and after the final exam, i somehow got a B (and both exams were 40% of grade). he posts ALL previous exams up so no surprise on whats going to be on them. highly recommended prof. encourages questions! wants his students to do well.

has a very kindly grandfatherly way about him. very approachable, knowledgable and best of all writes predictable, fair exams exactly like the past ones he posts online. also posts all notes online which are thorough and easy to follow. definitely recommended! awesome prof!

Great professor, very knowledgeable about the topic. Sometimes goes off on tangents, but explains the theory pretty well. In addition, all of his notes are available online. His exams are always similar to previous ones, just practice those (and understand the theory behind them) and you should be fine. Good class, highly recommended!

ONE OF THE BEST PROFESSOR'S! Extremely intelligent, replies quickly to emails and is very approachable. His midterms and finals are predictable, exactly the same as past one's and finals. Questions aren't "easy", but are defiantly fair, which is all you can ask for! VERY GOOD PROF! TAKE ALL HIS CLASSES!!!!!

Kasa is a good guy. His notes are posted online and he's rather approachable. He's highly intelligent butI think his lectures go a bit off tangent occasionally. The notes sometimes deviate from the book so make sure you emphasize the book rather than the lecture notes. His assignments are brutal but his exams are fair (and marked quite leniently).

He is an easy-going prof. The answers for his assignments can be found from his notes and textbooks. No tricky exam questions. Lecture notes are all posted online. I am going to stick with him in the next semester.

Mr. Kasa's assignments are tightly linked to his textbook and his textbook is tightly linked to his exams. Although this semester's class average is "unexpectedly lower than usual" he will be accomodating. I have not spoken to one to one, but from his emails you get a good feeling that he is a great person who cares for his students.
He is nice and helpful. Responds to emails and explains when you have problems. Talks a bit too fast in the lecture.
not too bad, but tooo much notes
A bit inexperience in teaching lower level econ course.  Howerver, he seems like a really really nice guy.  Exams are fair, and both TAs are excellent.
Too much notes, will be great if he post the notes online....other than that, he is pretty cool...exams are easy, similar to the assignments
Very likeable and friendly. However, too much lecture notes.  Exams are fair and relatively easy.
Speaks very quickly, but does go over the material multiple times. Speaks very quietly and without a microphone, so sometimes hard to hear. Overall, not great.

Avoid his 345 class at all costs all he does is read his lecture slides in the most monotonous voice. Class is like a black hole that sucks the life out of  you. You learn nothing from this class, no engagement. If you are looking to enjoy your econ class this is definitely not the prof to take it with. Be prepared to do a lot of self studying!

He was a nice prof, but his lectures were boring because he simply just read out the slides he made. However, the overall course was okay, the exams were based heavily on the lecture slides. As long as you study and understand the lecture slides, you will do well in this course. The average was so low because most students didn't attend classes

Dave Cox is super knowledgeable, the problem is the course content is unbearably boring. Do your tutorial assignments and do your textbook reading. Average course, you get what you put into it. Class is unbearable and not really necessary if you do well with self studies.

The class is incredibly boring, but it is pretty impossible to make Finance interesting so you can't put all the blame on Dave. He encourages questions from students and his exams are straight from his notes, so memorize them!
He sends his notes prior class. no need to buy the textbook, study his notes can lead you to a good grade. Easy midterm and assignments.

easy class. his lecture notes are clear, and very helpful. Assignments were easy if you put some effort. Midterm was pretty easy and final was ok. if you read the text and lecture notes few times, you'll be fine. recommended!

We need more David Cox in SFU! This prof's level of understanding in what he's teaching is amazing. He is able to communicate the materials in a way that none of the econ profs have been able to do. I just wish there's more time to learn from him.
sends out class notes in advance and overall is a very fair prof. As long as you study the notes you're all set. Easy A, go take his classes!
Extremely unhelpful during office hours. Better ask him in class.
Very good professor!  Very easy if you study his notes.  Recommend taking ANY class with him!
always well-prepared, very useful notes!
Best in SFU, moderate, and consistant prof.  If you study, we should at least got a B+
No Comments
not quite difficult exams,clear notes.
Again, study his notes and examples lots, read the text and you'll do fine
study his notes hard and u'll be on u'r way for at least a B
unclear teaching and hard exam!!!
if ur lazy like me....take him!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

For this course, the only upside is that the MC questions that are on the exams are already given during class...thus making the exam a lot easier to score a high grade. Overall, i felt that just reading his powerpoint notes or textbook on your own would be better. Do those tutorial questions and problem set and you will be fine
exam was too long and tedious with numerous multiple choice questions. he tries to make lectures interesting but unsucessful. overall, this is not a good course with heavy workload.

very very bad writing...but he posts good online notes anyways.  overall a pretty easy course, assignments were super easy, quizzes were tricky, the midterm/final were fair.  the m/c on the exams were actually harder than the long questions...
Super bad prof.notes are not clear.You need to study by yourself. Grading are hard. super mean prof. The worse prof I have in SFU. Even worse than Jiu..

Martin is a great professor for Econ students who excel more in their writing than their quantitative skills. His tests and assignments are more writing focused. While his lectures can feel a bit dry, he will gladly answer questions, and values student engagement. Textbook is not necessary, but can help for pre-reading for lectures.
If you're interested in the know how of forex and how it all interconnects. Martin is your guy.

This prof's files and lectures are super disorganized. His notes and the lectures are mixed up. His accent makes it tough to follow and you're not exactly able to follow along. It's a hot mess to do online
I say this after many Econ courses, this man knows how to teach. If you love Econ or interested in understanding how the markets/forex work this is your guy.

This prof is one of the best "econ" profs in SFU. He tries to make the lectures more engaging and I respect his efforts. His lectures were quite important and be sure to copy down his notes as he will be testing on those on the exams. The TA's of this course are tough graders (there are a few essays you need to write for this course). #Recommended!
the best econ professor in sfu
good
Great prof. Super easy to understand. Interesting lectures. Exams are not hard. They follow the textbook and class lectures well
NICE PROF EVER, U MUST TAKE THIS COURSE.

Although his lecture might be all over the place, Easton is an enthusiastic Prof.  If you visit his office hours he would be more then willing to help you out.  Textbook use is really high, exam questions are based on the text so there should not be any surprises if you get the concepts.  Just his writing is what makes the lectures difficult.

He's undoubtedly a great economist, however, his clarity needs improvement.Midterm was easy, final was easier.The questions were mostly analytical types and required you to fully understand the concepts rather than pure memorization.He's highly approachable and very knowledgeable in the field.If you want to learn something, take him.
He might be a little boring but he is a great prof. he knows so much and explain the class in a way that is easy to understand. You MUST read the textbook to know whats going on in the class.

He is the worst proof I have ever had. His lecture is not following the textbook. Exams are not hard. If you want to get a high mark and learn something in this course, try to avoid this man! Good luck!

wut de.. I studied so hard for this course. Never miss or skip any lecture/tutorial at all.. Put so much effort and time preparing for the final but still end up w/ a "C"... Unpredictable exam questions ~~ If u can, try avoid him!!!

One of the best profs ever. Tests are unique and actually test ability to think and analyze rather than memorize assignments and textbook and pass on that. Very knowledgeble on varity of macro and finance topics. If you want a prof that is creative and actually expalins w/o PowerPoint then Easton!!
he is a bad teacher. period.
